metadata.title: CVE-2019-0148 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Resource leak in i40e driver for Intel(R) Ethernet 700 Series Controllersversions before 7.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable adenial of service via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-198-generic - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-198-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-198-lowlatency - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-198-generic - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-198-lowlatency - 4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1083-aws - 4.4.0-1083.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-198.230~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1083.87').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
